abstract: An understandable decision adds to an institutional failure.
snippet: An understandable decision adds to an institutional failure.
lead_paragraph: Though I urged the New Jersey governor to consider running for president and liked his chances if he did, I can understand why Chris Christie has decided against a bid. The hour is late, the hurdles are significant, and if his candidacy crashed and burned Christie would have probably thrown away his still-young political career - and with it, his ability to fundamentally reform a long-misgoverned state. As Reihan Salam put it the other day, "New Jersey needs its governor," and a Republican Party that believes in the importance of federalism shouldn't necessarily be in the business of promoting its most successful state officials to the national level before their statehouse work has come to fruition. (See Palin, Sarah, for a cautionary tale on that front.)
